p: With the spread of the epidemic and the increase in the number of cases, COVID-19 patients may have atypical symptoms as the first manifestation. [ 29, 30] For such patients, “early detection, early diagnosis, and early treatment” should be achieved to avoid missed diagnosis. In the early stage of the disease, the total white blood cell count in the peripheral blood of most patients may be normal or reduced, the lymphocyte counts reduced, the high-sensitivity C-reactive protein increased, and normal procalcitonin. [ 17, 31– 33]
